bug.short_desc: API Viewer does not work with @see tags

long_desc.thetext:
The current API Viewer (online version) does not show a @see if it is specified within the comment. It just shows the string. An example can be found here: http://demo.qooxdoo.org/current/apiviewer/#qx.bom.Label~setContent We should check that and replace all @see tags in the comment description with @link tags.
Additionally the @see tag does not work even if it is specified right at the end of the comment. If such a @see tag is specified, the documentation just wont unfold. An example for that could be found here: http://demo.qooxdoo.org/current/apiviewer/#qx.bom.String~escape
I have just recognized that the problem is also available at the online version of the 0.8 API viewer!
How many comments are affected? Is it really the best strategy to replace all @see with @link as recommended, or is this easily be fixed?

Issue 1: In that case, @see is in curly braces which doesn't conform to te JSDoc standard and isn't supported by the API viewer. I agree that we should use the @link tag for this kind of inline link.
Issue 2: Fixed a problem with the HTML generation so @see now works if used as intended (e.g. qx.ui.table.ITableModel.getValue()).
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
